verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> unto<WH413> Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559>

Sanctify <WH6942> unto me all<WH3605> the firstborn,<WH1060> whatsoever<WH3605> openeth<WH6363> the womb<WH7358> among the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> both of man<WH120> and of beast:<WH929> it<WH1931> is mine.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto<WH413> the people,<WH5971> Remember<WH2142> <WH853> this<WH2088> day,<WH3117> in which<WH834> ye came out<WH3318> from Egypt,<WH4480> <WH4714> out of the house<WH4480> <WH1004> of bondage;<WH5650> for<WH3588> by strength<WH2392> of hand<WH3027> the LORD<WH3068> brought you out<WH3318> <WH853> from this<WH4480> <WH2088> place: there shall no<WH3808> leavened bread<WH2557> be eaten.<WH398>
This day<WH3117> came ye out<WH3318> <WH859> in the month<WH2320> Abib.<WH24>

And it shall be<WH1961> when<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> shall bring<WH935> thee into<WH413> the land<WH776> of the Canaanites,<WH3669> and the Hittites,<WH2850> and the Amorites,<WH567> and the Hivites,<WH2340> and the Jebusites,<WH2983> which<WH834> he swore<WH7650> unto thy fathers<WH1> to give<WH5414> thee, a land<WH776> flowing<WH2100> with milk<WH2461> and honey,<WH1706> that thou shalt keep<WH5647> <WH853> this<WH2063> service<WH5656> in this<WH2088> month.<WH2320>
Seven <WH7651> days<WH3117> thou shalt eat<WH398> unleavened bread,<WH4682> and in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> shall be a feast<WH2282> to the LORD.<WH3068>

Unleavened bread<WH4682> shall be eaten<WH398> <WH853> seven<WH7651> days;<WH3117> and there shall no<WH3808> leavened bread<WH2557> be seen<WH7200> with thee, neither<WH3808> shall there be leaven<WH7603> seen<WH7200> with thee in all<WH3605> thy quarters.<WH1366>

And thou shalt show<WH5046> thy son<WH1121> in that<WH1931> day,<WH3117> saying,<WH559> This is done because<WH5668> of that<WH2088> which the LORD<WH3068> did<WH6213> unto me when I came forth<WH3318> out of Egypt.<WH4480> <WH4714>

And it shall be<WH1961> for a sign<WH226> unto thee upon<WH5921> thine hand,<WH3027> and for a memorial<WH2146> between<WH996> thine eyes,<WH5869> that<WH4616> the LORD's<WH3068> law<WH8451> may be<WH1961> in thy mouth:<WH6310> for<WH3588> with a strong<WH2389> hand<WH3027> hath the LORD<WH3068> brought thee out<WH3318> of Egypt.<WH4480> <WH4714>
Thou shalt therefore keep<WH8104> <WH853> this<WH2063> ordinance<WH2708> in his season<WH4150> from year<WH4480> <WH3117> to year.<WH3117>

And it shall be<WH1961> when<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> shall bring<WH935> thee into<WH413> the land<WH776> of the Canaanites,<WH3669> as<WH834> he swore<WH7650> unto thee and to thy fathers,<WH1> and shall give<WH5414> it thee,

That thou shalt set apart<WH5674> unto the LORD<WH3068> all<WH3605> that openeth<WH6363> the matrix,<WH7358> and every<WH3605> firstling<WH6363> that cometh<WH7698> of a beast<WH929> which<WH834> thou hast;<WH1961> the males<WH2145> shall be the LORD's.<WH3068>

And every<WH3605> firstling<WH6363> of an ass<WH2543> thou shalt redeem<WH6299> with a lamb;<WH7716> and if<WH518> thou wilt not<WH3808> redeem<WH6299> it, then thou shalt break his neck:<WH6202> and all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> of man<WH120> among thy children<WH1121> shalt thou redeem.<WH6299>

And it shall be<WH1961> when<WH3588> thy son<WH1121> asketh<WH7592> thee in time to come,<WH4279> saying,<WH559> What<WH4100> is this?<WH2063> that thou shalt say<WH559> unto<WH413> him, By strength<WH2392> of hand<WH3027> the LORD<WH3068> brought us out<WH3318> from Egypt,<WH4480> <WH4714> from the house<WH4480> <WH1004> of bondage: <WH5650>

And it came to pass,<WH1961> when<WH3588> Pharaoh<WH6547> would hardly<WH7185> let us go,<WH7971> that the LORD<WH3068> slew<WH2026> all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> both the firstborn<WH4480> <WH1060> of man,<WH120> and the firstborn<WH1060> of beast:<WH929> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> I<WH589> sacrifice<WH2076> to the LORD<WH3068> all<WH3605> that openeth<WH6363> the matrix,<WH7358> being males;<WH2145> but all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> of my children<WH1121> I redeem.<WH6299>

And it shall be<WH1961> for a token<WH226> upon<WH5921> thine hand,<WH3027> and for frontlets<WH2903> between<WH996> thine eyes:<WH5869> for<WH3588> by strength<WH2392> of hand<WH3027> the LORD<WH3068> brought us forth<WH3318> out of Egypt.<WH4480> <WH4714>

And it came to pass,<WH1961> when Pharaoh<WH6547> had let<WH853> the people<WH5971> go,<WH7971> that God<WH430> led<WH5148> them not<WH3808> through the way<WH1870> of the land<WH776> of the Philistines,<WH6430> although<WH3588> that<WH1931> was near;<WH7138> for<WH3588> God<WH430> said,<WH559> Lest peradventure<WH6435> the people<WH5971> repent<WH5162> when they see<WH7200> war,<WH4421> and they return<WH7725> to Egypt: <WH4714>

But God<WH430> led the people about,<WH5437> <WH853> <WH5971> through the way<WH1870> of the wilderness<WH4057> of the Red<WH5488> sea:<WH3220> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went up<WH5927> harnessed<WH2571> out of the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And Moses<WH4872> took<WH3947> <WH853> the bones<WH6106> of Joseph<WH3130> with<WH5973> him: for<WH3588> he had straitly sworn<WH7650> <WH7650> <WH853> the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> God<WH430> will surely visit<WH6485> <WH6485> you; and ye shall carry up my bones away<WH5927> <WH853> <WH6106> hence<WH4480> <WH2088> with<WH854> you.
And they took their journey<WH5265> from Succoth,<WH4480> <WH5523> and encamped<WH2583> in Etham,<WH864> in the edge<WH7097> of the wilderness.<WH4057>

And the LORD<WH3068> went<WH1980> before<WH6440> them by day<WH3119> in a pillar<WH5982> of a cloud,<WH6051> to lead<WH5148> them the way;<WH1870> and by night<WH3915> in a pillar<WH5982> of fire,<WH784> to give them light;<WH215> to go<WH1980> by day<WH3119> and night: <WH3915>
He took not away<WH4185> <WH3808> the pillar<WH5982> of the cloud<WH6051> by day,<WH3119> nor the pillar<WH5982> of fire<WH784> by night,<WH3915> from before<WH6440> the people.<WH5971>
